gov.va.med.srcalc.domain.calculation

Class Calculation

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.va.med.srcalc.domain.calculation.Calculation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Calculation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    A risk calculation. You can think of this as a step-by-step builder of CalculationResult objects: set the patient, specialty, etc., and then call calculate(Collection) to produce the results.

    A stateful builder such as this (as opposed to a one-shot calculate() which could take all of the necessary data) allows features such as tracking the time the user takes to run a calculation and rerunning a calculation with tweaked input values.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public org.joda.time.DateTime getStartDateTime()
        The DateTime at which this builder object was created. Useful for tracking the amount of time it takes a user to run a calculation.

      • getVariables

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableSet<Variable> getVariables()

        Returns the Set of Variables that the calculation requires.

        The set will never contain more than one ProcedureVariable.

        Returns:
        an ImmutableSet
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no specialty has been set.
        ConfigurationException - if the set specialty requires multiple ProcedureVariables. (The admin UI does not allow definition of multiple ProcedureVariables.)

      • buildVariableGroupList

        protected java.util.List<PopulatedVariableGroup> buildVariableGroupList(java.util.Collection<? extends Variable> variables)
        Builds a brand-new, sorted list of PopulatedVariableGroups from the given variables. The groups are sorted by their natural ordering and each variable list is sorted by display name.

      • getVariableGroups

        public java.util.List<PopulatedVariableGroup> getVariableGroups()
        Returns all Variables associated with this Specialty, bucketed into their groups.
        Returns:
        an immutable List, sorted in group order
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no specialty has been set.

      • calculate

        public CalculationResult calculate(java.util.Collection<Value> values)
                            throws MissingValuesException
        Runs the calculation for each outcome with the given Values.
        Returns:
        the outcomes for convenience
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if incomplete values are provided
        MissingValuesException - if there are any required variables without an assigned value
